Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrookeM06
Reviews.Content: I visited this Ramada Hotel while in San Diego and decided to stay there only because I had a $25 credit for the hotel. When I got there, I had to wait almost 10 minutes for the service desk attendant to show up. No apology for the wait, all he said was "Yeah, can I help you?" I told him my name, he gave me the keys to the room and said nothing else. The elevator was a nightmare! Getting up to the 4th floor, I felt like my girlfriend and I would be stuck between 3rd and 4th floor. It started shaking once up on the 3rd floor. Also the only ice machine was on the 1st floor. Last and most importantly.....BUGS! I don't know if they were bed bugs or what, but I had bug bites on my arms and neck. This is very disgusting. I am not making this up and I have no reason to. I wouldn't stay here even if they paid me to.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in better, stayed in worse...stay away!”
Reviews.Author: we_be_d_travelers
Reviews.Content: Elevator problems -- thought we were going to have to spend the night in the elevator -- very scary -- air conditioner problems, thugs hanging out in the parking lot.. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Ramanda Plaza - San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 476Mike
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a trip with a college sports team to San Diego. This hotel was suggested by the event organizer and they came in with a reasonable bid. I communicated a lot with the manager before our arrival and everything was expected when we got there. I would stay here again if traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Many trips to front desk!”
Reviews.Author: Larkn5 Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: We first arrived for a one night stay turned out bad! Our first room was on the 4th floor and the elavator was broke..Then moved to another room where the air conditionor was removed and a window unit was installed...then we went to use the tv and the remote was broke inop..at this point we shut the lights off and went to sleep. The front desk staff seemed that it was just a job ,they took care of what we needed but felt like we were intruding on their time.. The internet seemed ok and the rooms are tiny,but if it's a one night stay it's very expensive for one night.good luck I myself did not read the reviews on this property and should have ...beware

Reviews.Title: “"A Horrible Experience"”
Reviews.Author: Sharee A
Reviews.Content: My church and I were attending a Youth Conference in San Diego this past weekend. I had been speaking with the sales and event coordinater through this hotel and assured us that things were going to be ready and together once we arrived. First off.,,the pictures on the website are so outdated..it doesnt even look like the hotel. The hotel is run down and nasty. I contacted the sales rep prior to us checking in and I told her that we wouldnt be checking in until late because our conference didnt end until late. But when we arrived the front desk person asked why are you all here so late! That is really rude considering you are just arriving. I was told that all rooms would have refrigerators and they werent. Some rooms had spiders and were dirty. Of course no one was going to come up and clean anything considering we were told that we were late checking in.It was the worst experience ever and I would never stay here again and never recommend this place to anyone!! It was really embaricing for the youth of our church to go home to there parents that they slept in dirty rooms. This is a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Emma R
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? First off, when we walked into the lobby, they had buckets set up around the floor to catch water that was dripping from the ceiling. Near our room, there were a couple of super shady looking guys who were standing outside the hotel. I watched them from my window because something seemed VERY off about them. It turns out, they were dealing drugs from the hotel. I had to walk back and forth with my 4 year old daughter by these two men for 3 days while we were there! They stood outside the ENTIRE time we were there as their customers pulled up in cars constantly! It was ridiculous and I was scared. When it came to the actual room....let me tell you, it was gross. The carpet was old, stinky and dirty. The paint and wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The bedding was old. The breakfast area was in the bar which was also old and falling apart. I was so disappointed with the entire stay. What a waste of money!! I will be returning to San Diego in a couple months and I would pay double at a different hotel just to avoid another nightmare stay!! Oh and the pool is a joke too. I would NEVER reccommed this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Flash, but was exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Kylie M
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed here in mid November 2011for 2 nights, we had just flown in from Australia and it was nothing flash but had clean rooms, light breakfast was included, fruit, waffles, cereal,it was enough for us till lunch time, free parking. We were only there for sleeping . The place is a little outdated but for the price we were happy, Clean and Safe.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cn42089
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheaper hotel in San Diego but not a scuzzy hotel. I wouldn't say this hotel was scuzzy, but definitely wasn't what I expected for a Ramada by looking at the pictures. First, when I checked in, I found that the king room that I reserved was unavailable and we had to settle for a double queen. We got to the room and it was just tiny. Second, the Pool was a long walk all outside to the back 40 of the hotel. When we got out to the pool, there were no towels. So the long walk back to the lobby in our suits to get towels. THe pool and hot tub were also not very clean. leaves and dirt at the bottom.Third, The elevator sounded like a dying cow, and we noticed the inspection report was 2 years overdue. Not a big deal but kind of weird for a hotel to not have up to date inspection reports. Breakfast was okay, although the bagels were stale all 3 days we stayed there. The door to our room did not close and latch without jimmying the door handle. Room service cleaned our room, and when we got back, found the room was unlocked and anyone could have gone in. That was annoying! Not like we had any valuables, but still... Overall a cheap hotel and not what I expected from a Ramada, but I guess you get what you pay for! If you want a decent hotel, you're going to have to pay more money. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Auntyam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine but the beds were seriously the most uncomfortable beds we have ever slept in! I won't ever stay in another ramada as I am worried all the beds will be that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but need some improvement”
Reviews.Author: Victor_Manuel
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in the hotel circle close to all the major attractions that you visit as a tourist, has free wifi and free parking, has a great occupancy was what I saw when I stay there last week, but need a lot of improvement in the rooms, it's old and needs a new fresh look

Reviews.Title: “RAMADA PLAZA SAN DIEGO HOTEL CIRCLE”
Reviews.Author: Artkatlcac
Reviews.Content: Looking for a nice cheap place to stay look no further, clean ,friendly ,nice room ,short distances from Old Town ,Airport. very satisfied , i usually stay at more expensive hotels but i was very surprised .

Reviews.Title: “RAMADA MMMmmmm.....not bad......”
Reviews.Author: tonyandwife04kids
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear a couple times, allway's in a 2 queen bed room its not a bad hotel its not the ritz let's use common sense here now but over all we allways had a clean room and a good stay. The bad Parking when there full the T.V channels terrible, continental breakfast in the morning not the food Too many people the location is bad must have car. The good free parking free wifi hotel has elevators and a fitness room free continental breakfast its good and great service really I'm not lying. All in all I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace to be called a Ramada”
Reviews.Author: harleyglidegwr
Reviews.Content: This run down hotel if you could call it that is the worst hotel ive ever set foot in. Nasty is to good a word to describe this run down hobo hotel.Let start with my window from the outside that couldnt close all the way so i we froze ,and the pool o my goodness ! I got a good price but no money is worth this raunchy hotel.Dont beleive the photo thats shown of this run down place there is no restaurant on the premises they turned that into your free breakfast in a cold dank room with the door open.Do yourself a favor look elsewhere.We had bad vibes going in should have trusted my instincts luckily only slept in this hobo inn . I still cant beleive ramada would let there good name be associated with a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Where to start??? Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2teens
Reviews.Content: Plese look at the pictures, The first picture is in the shower, I cleaned one spot and then took the picture. The second picture is what the shower looked like when we checked in. Third picture is of the fixture in the shower. No this is not a joke! Fourth picture is the A/C now look carefully at this. The space around it is open to the outside! Fifth picture, look at the headlights in the top of the A/C through the opening. That is Instertate 8. It is a very busy road 24 hours a day. The noise in that room is the same as having slept in a tent outside next to the freeway. There is/ was no way to block that out. Not to mention it is January and really cold. Sixth picture another view of the freeway. Seventh picture,, Black mold in the A/C. 8th pic, Day time. 9th pic, Not just our room that did not seal, none of the rooms had doors that close at the bottom. 10th picture is a shot looking down the hall, I wish you could get a sense of how dirty this place is. OK I booked this through a travel site, we arrived late and they put us in the wrong room to start with,1 bed for 4 people??? that room was gross too. When we finally got moved into this room, this is what we found. We stayed the first night because it was too late to go anywhere else. I called the travel site the next morning and they gave me a full refund for the four nights we had booked, which means that if we wanted to we could have stayed for free the next 3 nights. This place was so bad we checked out anyway and went to a different place where I had to pay. If they could not get me to stay for free then that must tell you something. There are so many more things I want to add here, but nevermind. Just run from this place. I don't know where they took the pictures they have on their web site, but they are a lie. I talked to several people out front in the morning while on hold with the travel site, and they were all going through the same thing, trying to book elsewhere. The hotel does not offer a refund on internet bookings so most of those people were stuck. I was lucky that the travel site I used refunded my money and agreed to deal with the hotel directly to get their money back.

Reviews.Title: “tilt a whirl bed”
Reviews.Author: sjohnson73107
Reviews.Content: First I want to say the Staff is exceptionally nice! I had a king bed that was on a queen bedframe. Frame appeared broke, they attempted to fix it, had to sleep in the center of the bed to have "level" area for sleep. Windows are very old and sweat and you can hear road noise at times (i was in the 2nd building) Furniture (other than bed) was in good condition. Bathroom needed some tile work attention. Room was clean however, very very out dated. with a little work and some new windows this could be a really good hotel. Free breakfast.....CARB central! Had fruit, some hard boiled eggs should be added to the buffet. The breakfast room does have a kitchen in the back so this could easily be done.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to rest before flying”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: It's an easy drive from this hotel to the airport, so a good choice if you're flying out early. Checking in after midnight, I felt a little uneasy as I drove back to the large, tenement-looking building in the rear where my room was located. The parking lot was overly crowded and the building looked really run down, the corridors shabby and ugly. However, when I entered my room, I found it entirely satisfactory for a night's stay. The bed was comfortable and the shower worked well. I'd recommend this place, especially if you can check in before dark and avoid the very creepy ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: supwomen
Reviews.Content: We booked are stay at ramada in San Diego 2151 hotel cir. Upon check in the desk clerk had a cold or something and was coughing all over people.The lobby smelled as if the tiolet had backed up, the carpet was stained and looked moldy. Upon checking the two rooms, one room the door was broken the carpet had a large white sticky stain one it and the room smelled like urine. The shower and sink had the stoppers removed and had hair globs hanging from them.The second room bed sheets were dirty as if someone had walked all over them the bed valence was stained and the bathroom had mold growing in the shower. The desk clerk was told and stated many people need rooms we dont care.

Reviews.Title: “Sticky floors, tiny rooms...”
Reviews.Author: sol a
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations going into this, as the Hotel Circle area has really gone downhill, but we were actually disgusted at the condition of this place. Carpets were sticky and smelled of cigarettes. Room was smaller than any motel we've ever stayed at, Approx 250 sq ft. Bed was comfy, but very loud. Breakfast was stale pastries and spoiled milk, with a "Make your own Waffle" station. Probably used to be a nice hotel 20 years ago, but now it's no different than any other crappy motel in this area. Save 30 bucks and stay at the Motel 6... the "free breakfast" isn't worth it. Also were treated poorly due to booking through 3rd party website (rude lady at front desk).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, disgusting rooms, ants in the room”
Reviews.Author: IRISHIWASINCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza hotel on 10/12/11 & 10/13/11 and will never go back again. The rooms were dirty and carpet badly stained. On the morning of 10/13/11 I awoke to find black ants crawling throughout my bathroom area and on my ceiling. I called the front desk to report the problem and request that housekeeping please clean the room as we were leaving for the zoo. She was polite and said she would take care of the problem. When I returned to my room around 630-7pm the ants were even worse and the room had not been serviced. I called the front desk and spoke with a male who told me that housekeeping was gone for the day but that he would have maintenance come over for the ant problem.......nobody ever showed up. When I checked out the following day the ants were all over my room, the room had not been serviced at all during my two night stay, and I was happy to be heading back to AZ after this miserable stay. The general manager was not available when I checked out but I was given her email address and phone number. I left Tameka a voicemail- no response. I sent her an email- no response. WOW- great customer service!? Warning- stay away from this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice n quiet”
Reviews.Author: tabullen
Reviews.Content: Found thru roomsaver.com. Was $65 per night for 3 nights. Very good value. Rooms were quiet, clean and comfy. Staff were excellent, Breaky was great. We had rooms at the back of hotel. Restaurant next door was very good value also, making for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Hotel Circle!”
Reviews.Author: lalaguna9
Reviews.Content: My sister, my dad and I stayed here for 5 days while we were moving my sister into college at Point Loma Nazarene University. Before choosing the Ramada we were looking at the Days Hotel down the street which was way overpriced. The manager there told us the rates at every other hotel would be similar, which was a lie. Anyways, the Ramada was great! The price was super affordable and the amenities were great. There was a pool and a jacuzzi right outside our building. The pool was heated as well so it was great for a nighttime dip. There was also complimentary breakfast which was delicious. Items ranged from cereal and fruit, to waffles, pastries, and bagels. There was also a workout room in the hotel which was one of the amenities I was looking for that Days Hotel did not have. While the Ramada was right off the highway, we were in the building that was the farthest set back, and were never disrupted by traffic at all. Parking was included in the charges and there was both indoor and outdoor parking spaces. The view from the hotel was of the hilly California landscape, and there were great sunsets in the area. Location was another strong suit for this hotel. It seemed like we could get everywhere we needed to in 20 minutes or less. The airport was super close, as well as downtown San Diego, and my sister's school. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Ramada at Hotel Circle in San Diego. p.s. The only downside was that you are charged a 20 per day deposit that you receive back at the end that would cover any damages that might occur. This was not verbally made know when we charged the room to our card...however it was explained on a plaque at the front desk that we noticed later. p.s.s. I would recommend calling for deals before getting to the hotel. I don't know if it mattered but we got a great deal through reserving over the phone only minutes before we showed up.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza...decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: RAH_RAHx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in August of 2011. Beds were super comfy and the hotel was decent for what we paid. Easy to find off the freeway, and pretty much a straight shot to the Mission Beach area. Breakfast decent too!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Ghetto!”
Reviews.Author: P J
Reviews.Content: Ramada should be ashamed of having their name associated with this property! Looks like they took out the vending and ice machines from every floor except the 1st floor. I would never venture to the ice machine alone, as it was located at the end of a hallway behind a closed door where any undesirable person could hide and attack you! I was surprised there was no fridge in the room. One of the light fixtures didn't work. The door to the bathroom did not lock. We had 4 people in our room and were only given two bath towels. TV didn't offer any local channels and we couldn't plug in our Nintendo Wii that we brought for entertainment. Breakfast was another letdown. Orange juice was watery. Waffles were rubbery. Hotel is very outdated. Needs to be completely closed down and renovated. I expected a lot more from Ramada. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: cherieb42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in San Diego for Comic Con. Got a decent rate, given that the Con was going on and most hotels were charging ridiculous rates. When I called a few days prior, I asked the staff if there was anyway I could check in early, as I was getting into San Diego at 11am. They said they would check to see if they had a room available, and if they did, I could check in early. Well, when I got there, I was told I had to wait. The parking lot was empty, so there had to be rooms that were ready, but they didn't even check. I thought that was rude. The hotel property itself is in desperate need of updating. While the lobby was clean and bright, the hallways in the back of the hotel are dirty and the carpet was in horrible shape. I was somewhat leary of seeing what the rooms looked like. Small pool looked clean, but I didn't use it. The breakfast room was not kept very clean, and the bar was so old and dated that I had to laugh. Parking is barely sufficient for the amount of rooms. very cramped. Surprisingly, the room was pretty clean. No stains or peeling wallpaper, and the bathroom was nice and clean. Room service did a good job my entire stay. The TV is an old tube-style, and the picture was terrible. The furniture is very worn. The pillows were small and not very comfortable. High speed internet worked fine the entire stay. Breakfast consisted of waffles, muffins, cereal, breads, yogurts, and juices. Standard stuff and free so I couldn't complain. Just wished they kept it cleaner. Hotel is only 10 minutes to the Gaslamp area and all major attractions such as the Zoo, U.S.S. Midway, and Old Town. There is also a nice casino in Barona, which is only about a 30 minute drive. I've stayed in worse places, but I hope they follow through on their mission to update the property. It's in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: melcff
Reviews.Content: We booked our room and I wad leery to stay here with the reviews I read. First the front staff were rude when we arrived early and asked about checking in early. He abruptly told us no our room will not be ready until 3:00. I wanted to cancel then but my husband wanted to stick it out. We took our son to the beach to kill time. We returned at 3:00 to check in and our room was in the back. HORRIBLE parking. We struggled to park our crossover as did others we noticed. Our room looked clean enough, carpet is gross. But we have a bathroom sink that leaks and a light over the vanity that turns on and off by itself. There was mold on the ceiling above the shower. This is our first night of a four night stay let's see if we make it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: 2006mommy
Reviews.Content: The woman who took our reservation ensured us a clean, 3 star hotel, large deluxe room, with hot breakfast (eggs, meat, waffles, etc.). The hotel is maybe a 1 star and we received none of the things promised when making our reservation. The hotel lobby was the only clean, updated part of the hotel although it still had an old musky smell about it. We stayed in the back building. As we entered the building and walked to our room the smell was over whelming. The carpet was fifthly and dirt/dust was everywhere. The elevator was extremely slow and sounded broken half the time (not to mention it smelled of smoke as other guests smoked in the elevator). My husband would not ride in it after the first day. The door to the stairway was broken and took the effort of a strong man to open it. We came close to calling the fire department to report the fire hazard after it would not open after multiple tries. The only redeeming factor to our stay was that the very small room (nowhere close to deluxe) was clean with the exception of the carpet. The carpet was old and very dirty with a dusty smell to it. We traveled with our 3 small children (4 mths, 3 & 5 years) so the free hotel breakfast was very appealing to us. Big disappointment. The breakfast room was super small, dark, muggy, and dirty. The only “hot” items on the menu were waffles and toast. No eggs or breakfast meat as promised. After the 1st morning in the breakfast room I refused to take my young children again and went every morning to get their breakfast and took it back to our room. There was no check in at the breakfast room and other guests from neighboring hotels walked in off the street for a free breakfast making the small room even smaller. On the last morning at the hotel we all showered, including my young children, with cold water. NO HOT WATER! I have never heard of any hotel running out of hot water! I will never stay at any Ramada again. They have lost our business!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but the hotel is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: FootballM0m
Reviews.Content: We blocked 12 rooms for our youth football team tournament. We were all in the building in the back of the property. While the lobby was clean and bright, things went downhill as we went uphill to our rooms. Old and run-down are the words that come to mind. Our room, while small, was clean, but the toilet ran constantly. The sink was cracked. The hallways and carpets were worn and dirty. The "security" doors at the end of the hall did not lock. The elevator was scary. It had only a 500 lb weight limit posted and was slow and noisy. One father on our team leaned against a railing on the outdoor staircase and discovered a bolt was missing. Thank goodness a child didn't discover that first and fall. I reported it to the desk and they replaced the bolt, but why was it like that in the first place? The equipment in the "fitness center" was inadequate and broken. The pool was so tiny that not everyone who wanted to swim could get in, and there were only a few chairs, most of which were falling apart. There were never towels at the pool. I encountered a homeless man rummaging through the dumpster in the parking garage. Our team had an early football game and needed to leave at 6:00 am. One mom on our team asked if the boys could grab something from the breakfast room before we left and we were told no, it doesn't open until 6:30. I don't understand why they couldn't open a half hour early and let them grab a muffin "to go". The breakfast room was so small and poorly laid-out that it would have been easier for the other guests to not have our team in there eating. And while I know that it's not part of the property, the abandoned spa store in front of the hotel is downright frightening. Someone needs to tear it down and clean up that property. Ramada should at least put up a good fence or plant a hedge to block the view. In spite of all the above, the staff was friendly and hard-working. I hope they get a remodeled hotel to work in someday.

Reviews.Title: “even if this hotel is cheaper, look elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: momcop
Reviews.Content: Expedia had a special deal and I fell for it! Wrong! The staff was nice, but the hotel was old and needed work. There were rat traps all around the outside of the building--probably due to overflowing garbage cans (I saw no rats, but the evidence of the traps chilled me). The hotel was probably really fancy 25 years ago, but needs a LOT of maintenance. The sheets and towels looked very clean, the room seemed clean, but the carpet was little more than indoor/outdoor. We could hear the people over us almost all evening. The breakfast was very good, but the breakfast area was dark and 70-ish looking. I guess I would stay there if I had to, but I would look elsewhere first. There are a LOT of hotels nearby (Comfort Inn was next door, Quality Inn across the street, etc) and if it were only $25 or so difference, I would try another location. There is a little diner next door (Ricky's) which is nice and clean, not busy, and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough but only just.”
Reviews.Author: Wildtony
Reviews.Content: Traveling on our honeymoon around California, we were hoping to find a decent hotel after spending a few nights in some real dives while on the road. This hotel was adequate with a decent sized room with great air-conditioning, a decent breakfast included, comfy bed and good location to sea world and San Diego zoo by car. The downsides are the location on the side on the freeway also means that the rooms get a lot of traffic noise if you have the window open, there is also some construction noise from the adjacent lot however it wasn't a problem with the window closed. Our bathroom also suffered a lack of water pressure and our hand basin seemed incapable of producing anything other than hot water. Given we were only in town for two nights this place was tolerable but I'm sure that there are better digs to be found in San diego for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, but unpleasant experience with the breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: rghouston
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in the hotel in the front section right near the elevator. We have found the hotel staff at the front desk very pleasant and helpful, the room is fine and everything works in it. The hotel looks like it needs a little uplift, and the breakfast room definitely does, but no complaints about any of that. We got a very good price. The major negative in out stay is the setup in the breakfast from. The congestion is horrendous, and could be resolved by simply setting up the coffee and the juice stations in different parts of the room so that you don’t have to wait while other people are making and waiting for their waffles. All the serving stations for the food are bunched up in the same section of the room and you cannot get to anything when the crowd gets big. It is a very unpleasant experience that could be easily remedied if anyone gave it a little thought! The internet provided works, but there is a cable plug in the room that does nothing. Wireless access worked fine, but logs itself out and each time you want to connect, you have to go through the acknowledgment again, which I found awkward and annoying. It would be much easier to have a login password that my computer would remember and connect through. I also don’t understand why I cannot get a PBS station on the television. There seems to be a lot of movies available, but none were free. This was not much problem because I didn’t care to watch a movie, but it seems there should be something available anyway. With the exception of the breakfast room, I rate our stay as just fine for the price. Don’t expect too much and this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLeah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is being upgraded and currently some areas show their age, particularly the breakfast room. Our rooms (we booked 2) were completely adequate. Clean beds, TV that worked well, very basic type budget room. The shower worked well, lots of pressure and hot water. Plenty of clean towels. Check in staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The location was perfect, just a few minutes away from Old Town, the Zoo and very close to Sea World etc. I found the quality of the bed and bedding better than I expected, the rest of the room was as expected, functional but in need of refreshing. Breakfast is complimentary with the room but get in early. We arrived at 9am, which is 30 minutes before breakfast ends and I think half the hotel had the same idea. The staff worked hard to keep the muffins, yoghurt, fruit etc replenished but there was a traffic jam by the toaster, waffle maker and coffee. Arrive for breakfast by 8am to avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Thefamilyguyken
Reviews.Content: This place has gone totally down hill! The rooms and hallways are disgusting in the back portion of the hotel. The room had water stains on the ceiling and the plumbing leaked! The staff and management (Tamika?)are arogant and condescending when dealing with our concerns and complaints. I have stayed here in the past with some of my company employees, but the hotel has degraded signicantly. I am sure there are better values on the hotel circle

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude Manager + Lousy Room = Why Stay here?!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan93003
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this location in the past and have been happy with the room and service. However, i stayed here 2 monthes ago and was placed in the old dilapadated rear section of the hotel. So i made a new reservation requesting the front section for this stay. I was rudely told by the manager "Tamika" that this was all that was available. The rear section of the hotel is still in disrepair with holes in the floor in the hallways, water stains on the ceilings and a very bad odor that is attempted to be masked with an exrememly strong air freshener. Tamika was so rude to us that I will not use this or any other Ramada or Wyhndam property in the future. Also the parking at this location has become problematice with small and inadequate number of parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK, but”
Reviews.Author: shop99er
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Very quiet, even though I-8 is a stone's throw away. The best nights' sleep so far on this trip, The bed was great. My issues are eith the mechanical side. The bathroom sink had a leak in the piping, causing a puddle to form on the tile floor, The shower curtain rod was not hung correctly, so the shower curtain would sag into the middle, letting more water onto the tile floor. And since that wasn't enough fun, we had to let the shower run for 10 minutes before there was hot water coming out of it. We told the front desk twice about this, and none of these items were fixed when we checked out after 3 days. BTW, the room number was 423

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, so so room”
Reviews.Author: CollegeStudent_21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was... ok. We also had the unfortunate experience of inadvertantly booking during comic con. Our rate was over $90 something dollars on the cheapest night and $135 on the weekends, but it was one of the cheapest in the area during that weekend. We stayed four nights. We booked months in advance, but due to a missed flight arrived very late at night and was told our room had been given away! Even though we called from the airport updating them on our arrival status several times. Once we arrived, the staff was very helpful in securing us a room at another property for the night (and paying for it of course) and the front desk worker just getting off his shift was even nice enough to drive us there himself instead of having to make us wait for a cab. We had a room in the very back building so no traffic noise to speak of. We also overlooked the pool which was warm and clean when we used it. The whole building smelled like old people. The room had a desk, fridge, microwave, table, tv, and two beds all stuffed into one room so it was a little cramped. The wifi came in great. There was a bus stop right outside the hotel which was very convenient since we did not rent a car. During checkout, our bill was not correct due to the initial error of us not staying the first intended night. The front desk staff and manager were helpful in resolving this issue for us and we were refunded the amount we overpaid within a week. Our flight didn't leave till late so they let us store our bags at the desk while we went out on more adventures. I would not recommend the restaurant, however. Because of our troubles, the front desk issued us free breakfast vouchers. Because we weren't paying, the waitress actually went out of her way to ignore us the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: fabiano_ffaustino
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife and two small children we spend three nights at this hotel. That was the first hotel during our 30 day vacation trip that we didn’t have made any reservation, because I assumed that there are so many Hotels in San Diego, specially at this region. The Hotel is quite well located, close to the main parks (Sea Word – 5 minutes and San Diego Zoo – 16 minutes), the front desk people was really nice and helpful as well the maintenance personnel. The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. Yes, there is a noise issue because of the road, but the Hotel have rooms in the back that may be asked too. We were ok with the noise. Free parking, internet access to the hotel guest’s computer and complimentary coffee made a very good difference. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is better than this dump”
Reviews.Author: firetup
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience for a 5-night stay...door lock was busted and it took 3 days for maintenance to temporarily fix the door jam misalignment with out moving rooms as an alternative option. Front desk personnel were idiot stoners, maid walked in on me coming out of the shower without knocking, non smoking room smells like smoke, no pool towels, food/grease stained sheets (yuck), crappy food at the Panini breakfast bar, terrible parking & wayyyy too much chlorine in the spa! I'll never stay here again nor do I recommend it to anyone...ps, it's privately owned.

Reviews.Title: “rundown and no hot water”
Reviews.Author: Andeez
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not in very good condition. my room had a lot of old style decor, bathroom and chipped paint. door was not in good condition as it looked as if it had been kicked in sometime before. i also had no hot water in my shower. my friend who stayed at the hotel in a different room also had no hot water. the location is poor because there's nothing really around it that's walking distance but it's conveniently located right off the freeway and a short drive to a lot of stuff. poor construction as well. you could hear everything through the walls including loud plumbing noises.

Reviews.Title: “NO LONGER A FAN OF THIS PROPERTY.”
Reviews.Author: BLACKS_BEACH_FAN
Reviews.Content: I must start off by saying that I have previously stayed at this hotel for a five night stay in July of 2008. I booked a BUSINESS CLASS room which was superior to the STANDARD KING OR STANDARD QUEEN rooms. During this 2008 stay I was VERY pleased with the comfort of my room and the service of the hotel. My BUSINESS CLASS room included upgraded newer dark wood furnishings, a superior bed, and very superior bedding. I was very happy with the size and comfort level of my room. It is fair to say that the Ramada Plaza is an older property and is in need of some updating. The carpeting in the hallways is very dirty and there is a slight smell, but no property is perfect. The only issue I experienced during my first stay was the power to the room going out 3 times during my stay. This was usually resolved within 15 - 20 minutes when a maintenance man would flip a circuit breaker switch in the lower part of the building. It was annoying, but not enough to ruin my stay or opinion of the property. I made plans to attend San Diego Pride late in 2009. Knowing I'd be in San Diego for the festival in July 2010, I searched Hotel Circle properties and found what I thought was a very good rate for the Ramada Plaza. I booked my reservation for my July 2010 stay in January. I once again booked a business class king room. The rate was an average of $85 a night for my 5 night stay. Upon my arrival on July 16th 2010, I was assigned a room on the 3rd floor of the back building of the property. This was the exact floor and building where my previous room was. The front desk clerk (BILL) was quite nice and quickly checked me in. Once I found my room and walked in I immediately called the front desk to verify that I was in the correct room for the BUSINESS CLASS room that I had reserved and paid a slightly higher rate for. My call was answered by a young lady at the front desk and her first response to my question was a very audible sigh of indignation that I was questioning the accuracy of my room. I was very polite in my conversation with her, never raised my voice, and only asked a simple question. She responded that the room I was in was indeed a BUSINESS CLASS room. After her tone and manner to my question I simply said "well if that's the case then I guess I'll just have to accept it." The BUSINESS CLASS room that I was assigned on this stay included the shabbiest furnishings of any hotel that I've ever stayed in. The bleached oak laminate bed, desk, table & chairs appeared to have been purchased around 1989. The bedding was the exact comforter pictured in the hotels room pictures of a STANDARD KING room. It was certainly not the superior bed and white down comforter and duvet that I received in my previous BUSINESS CLASS room during my 2008 stay. This room was also smaller than the room I received in 2008. I honestly felt that I was not given the room that I had booked and paid for. In fairness to Ramada Plaza, The STANDARD KING room that I was in was comfortable, it was clean, the bed itself was good, and the room did have new or newly cleaned carpeting. It was probably some of the cleanest carpeting I've ever seen in a hotel of this class. The sink in the bath area and the additional sink / vanity area just outside the bath area made it convenient for two people to get ready at once. I also experienced very little noise problems. The other negative issues I experienced besides the room bait & switch issue were with the television, the safe, and housekeeping. The first night in the room my television did not work, some error message kept coming on the screen after it was turned on for 20 seconds. I reported this to the front desk and after just over an hour a property maintenance employee wheeled up a new television and installed it while we were out. After waiting for over an hour our plans forced us to leave the room so the employee had to install the new TV while we were gone. It was nice to return and have the problem resolved though. The in room safe did not work and we were unable to store our laptop in it. On the first full day of our stay, we left the room around 11 am. Upon our return around 8 pm that night we noticed the door to our room was open. The interior swing bar security latch had been swung out towards the hallway and the door was open about an inch. I believe housekeeping staff use that swing bar to prop the doors open as they are coming and going from the rooms to their cart during the room maintenance process. Our door had never been secured after the maid had finished her duties. We rushed into the room and looked around, the bed was made and the bathroom cleaned. Nothing was missing and the laptop was still in the room, but it was EXTREMELY UNNERVING to walk up to the room in the hallway and find the door open. It was only sheer luck that didn't experience a theft from our room. A complaint was immediately made to the front desk and we were assured the maid would be admonished. As far as the housekeeping itself, our maid was very good at keeping the room cleaned. I did tip her generously each day of our stay (It is proper etiquette to do so.) even with the security lapse. If you're simply looking for a clean room with minimum comfort at an inexpensive price, the Ramada Plaza isn't a bad place to stay. If you are looking for level of comfort or service above the very minimum then you should probably book a room esle where. If you do stay at this property, DO NOT pay more than $100 a night. The rooms are NOT worth more than that. The STANDARD room quality and service of the hotel is quite basic so you could probably find a room on par with this property at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: runjrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and brought home ants. I spoke to the manager and he told me the hotel was built on an ant hill. Then he told me I must have gotten the ants from another place. But I did not stay anywhere else. Then he asked if there is anything he could do for me and when I suggested a price adjustment, he said he couldn't do that. Why ask if you won't do anything. An unsatisfactory stay. Rooms had a musty odor.

Reviews.Title: “location! and great for the rate”
Reviews.Author: Retrorich
Reviews.Content: look, don't stay if you're looking to be pampered but at $65 a night--thats a great deal. its no frills but hotel circle is a great location if you want to hit a bunch of places in one short trip--downtown, balboa park, beaches, malls, etc. of course hotel circle really depends on when you go-- yo umay be dealing with lots of kids and whatnot running around if it is a busy weekend the pool is fantastic--heated and the hot tub is actually HOT, unlike most places that just heat them luke warm. perfect if you want to relax after a long day of sightseeing. ps skip the tickled trout--the on-site restaurant. there are just too many restaurants in san diego to bother with this. too old and in need of renovation. but if you want to get all loopy and sing karaoke there on weekends, be my guest

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay very much”
Reviews.Author: familyman7777
Reviews.Content: Great shuttle service. Kudos to Luke for knowledge and friendliness!!! Great pool with nice hot tub, very courteous and helpful staff.. top notch! Shuttle took us to Sea World, Balboa Park etc. Saved tons on car rental

Reviews.Title: “Good for Overnight Stay From San Diego Airport”
Reviews.Author: JewelieRees
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of an offer from Sam's Club, and booked 3 months in advance. However, if we had paid full price ($114 for a king size bed on a Friday night in October) we would have just as well stayed at one of the competetors' on the same street. Free Shuttle from airport required you call on arrival, and then pickup was 40 minutes out from that. Runs to the airport in morning require planning ahead. The room was average, cramped bath, not superior cleaning. But the bed was very comfortable--a welcome sight at 11pm! It was noisy outside, but the hotel did a good job promoting special events at their restaurant and bar. There was not a continental breakfast in morning, but restaurant offered decent food at average prices from 6am-11pm. Our waitress was the nicest person we encountered in service at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Momkey
Reviews.Content: ALL the tires on our car were FLATTENED.. The staff was not all helpful. They just kept saying "We are not responsible". We had parked right in front of the security guard and bellhop booth. There is no parking if you return late from the amusement parks. We had to drive around and around or park on the dirt next door at an empty building. Maybe if they at least would have offered a complimentary breakfast in their antique restaurant while we waited for the tow truck I would have let pass the MUSTY SMELL in the room because it would go away after turning on the vent. The poor lighting in the bathroom could not be fixed but they did put a door on the safe after the 1st day. Pay the extra money for parking at the Comfort Inn .

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Field_4
Reviews.Content: Old, musty, bad parking. Don't dare try to check in before 3pm. Does not accomodate requests most times. Rates are very reasonableand make up for short comings.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than other hotels in hotel circle, but not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: traveler3749
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ramada Inn located on Hotel Circle in San Diego. Unfortunately I stayed on a weeked where there was a "Comic-Con," which raised the prices off the charts. The average hotel even a lower brand were above $150/night. I found a great deal at Ramade Inn for only $105/night for the Saturday/Sunday nights. The price was cheap, but not worth it. The room was very humid inside and the AC was not on. We had to turn it on and it took over 30 minutes to let the air inside the room. Very musty inside and the bathroom was very dirty, with rust/mold on the corner of the door and near the tub. I will not stay here again and it's not worth the cheaper rate. Just pay a little more and stay somewhere else. The location is very nice. Hotel Circle is just minutes away from all the attractions and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a motel - a bit dark in room!”
Reviews.Author: simstr
Reviews.Content: we were here as part of a 3 week tour around LA and vegas stayed here 2 nights room is very dark and 70s decor - but clean and basic we upgraded and got fridge and m/wave pool was fine and clean and small spa area staff polite and efficient area - there is nothing in the area other than motels - it is by the freeway - but not noisy the zoo is 5 minutes away - easy to get to there and to the marina etc went to gaslamp district - that is the place to go - loads of restaurants and lively!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mel_nz_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here cos the place next door was full but we were impressed with the hotel and its staff. The receptionist got a very good deal on a room, although the room was a bit smaller than we would have liked but it was ok. Bed was nice, bathroom very clean. We didnt try the restaurant as the food didnt sound like what we like. Spa was ok, some of the jets werent working, and it was a few minutes walk outside from the hotel. Close to many attractions. They say that they sell cheap tickets to many attractions but we got better prices by buying the tickets from the actual attractions. All the staff we had interactions with were very nice. The room was very well soundproof, busload of teenages there our first nght and they were very noisy late at night and early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Rave reviews for our stay at the Ramada!”
Reviews.Author: sweetestsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza prior to and upon returning from a cruise out of San Diego. From someone who works in a five star hotel and spa I found the Ramada Plaza to be an excellent place to stay. Usually I do not expect much from a hotel/motel type establishment, but I must admit I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel, rooms, and amenity areas were clean and well kept, the staff were knowledgable, friendly and very approachable for any questions or assistance. AMENTITIES: The hotel offers an airport shuttle that you can also use to take you places in the area. Members in our group used the shuttle to go to and from town, Sea World (5-7 min away), the San Diego Zoo (10-15 min away, otherwise a $22 dollar cab ride) and to the embarking and disembarking area for the cruise ships. On the day that one of their drivers called in sick and the shuttle was consequently not running the hotel paid our cab fare to the airport. None of the beverage machines seemed to be working in the hotel that we could find, but we got complimentary sodas from the front desk. There is also complimentary internet in the lobby with free printer access and complimentary tea and coffee (possibly 24hr from what we saw, but I am not sure) in the lobby. The outdoor pool and hot tub are open till midnight, the latest hours I have ever seen! FOOD: The Tickled Trout Restaurant was on the small and dark side but the food and service was excellent. With your room you receive coupons towards breakfast, and the 1/2 priced Happy Hour menu in the bar was perfect after spending all of our money in Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very helpful”
Reviews.Author: JLBNottsUK
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us from the UK of varied ages ( 21 - 78) stayed 1st - 6th Oct and also 18th - 20th October 2008. The staff were very helpful, the hotel was clean. A few of us had minor issues (light bulb out etc), which were sorted immediatley. We had no problems parking, the pool was excellant, the staff were superb, especially the bell boys. No need to hire a car, the shuttle bus took us everywere - all it costs is a tip to the driver - well done! The only issue we had was one of the bar staff in the Tickled Trout - he needed more customer service training! The food was slightly more expensive than anticipated, however Ricky's next door does excellant food at reasonable prices. Overall we rated the hotel 9 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: ben0064
Reviews.Content: Terrible cancellation policy with book direct in Ramada web site. I made my reservation a month ago for Oct 19-23 staying Ramada Plaza Hotel Circle with book direct in Ramada site. The site did said about their hotel policy "Rest Easy" with no fee for change and cancellation. However when I try to like to make a cancellation today, I was informed that my reservation is not changeable with no cancellation and full payment of due to special rate. Reservation agent told me that I had to paid attention to the fine details in my confirmation and there is nothing she can do to help me. Special rate? I found the same rate in Expedia.ca but with much better cancellation policy. Best Western has similar special rate and with no penalty up to 2 day prior. Learn my lesson and will never book with Ramada direct. Benjamin

Reviews.Title: “Business Class”
Reviews.Author: work2travel00
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here in the past 6 months. Once again we were very pleased. Staff is very friendly, beds are comfy and it's worth the little extra to get the Business Class room (it comes with a fridge, a microwave and coffee). Hallways a little worn but overall we were very pleased. Also, the restaurant onsite, the Tickled Trout, has great breakfast and if you like Mexican food, be sure to go to Casa Guadalajara about two miles west of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bostonSkT
Reviews.Content: The first night I was in San Diego we stayed at the Kings Inn, this turned out to be a terrible mistake - The next morning I went online and found this Ramada. I drove down the street to view the hotel and the front desk allowed me to go up and check out a room. Instead of having to go back online and book the room they price matched the rates for me. The staff was very friendly, professional and accommodating. Since the room was free they allowed me to check in immediately, instead of having to wait until normal check-in @ 3pm. This was a big help! The rooms were spacious and clean, and it even smelled clean. Bathrooms were nice, and there was adequate closet & counter space. Having a refrigerator in the room was a nice amenity. The attached pub had karaoke, and a relatively fun crowd.. however the prime rib bites had me down and out with food poisoning the next day. The location is great! Very close to Old Town, and only 5 - 10 min from downtown / zoo / Petco Park .... This hotel & staff made me forget about the bad first night I had at the other place. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Tesajb
Reviews.Content: I don't normally have really high expectations of Ramada's but this one definitely was not worth the price. The hotel had insufficient parking and in close quarters. We managed to find a "secret hidden" parking area behind our room. There was the option of parking in a covered garage but it was full of random furniture and there was another car in there with a flat tire. It was entirely un-inviting. When we got into the hotel I was shocked to see the carpet in the hallway was incredibly dirty. I figured if that was any indication of how the room was I was going to turn around and find another place to stay. The room was okay but I found a used bar of soap in the shower. The bed was hard and the tv remote barely worked. For the high price, it was definitely not worth it. I definitely will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: bbailey
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay. I was a little leary after asking for a refrigerator and microwave in our room and being placed in two rooms that didn't have both, but it was rectifed VERY quickly for our third on the same floor. The staff is very accomodating. Each time we called and said, no, this room doesn't have both, they tried to remedy it right away. The third time was a charm and was done very quickly and were very nice about it. The room was comfortable. The bed was a little hard for my taste but the pillows were VERY fluffy.We had originally asked for a king smoking room and ended up with a double queen, but it worked out great because we had more room to sort through our stuff that was packed and during for the trip. The wireless hookups in our room worked good for my hubby's laptop internet access for work related stuff, as well as last minute site seeing information websites.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed-beds are awful ! Run down !”
Reviews.Author: tutorpro
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at the Best Western in Old Town but after visiting the San Diego Visitor center, they suggested this Ramada Inn for less money. What a terrible mistake we made cancelling our reservation at the Best Western. After visiting Old Town, we realized we made a big mistake. The Best Western would have been a better choice---better location by far and so much nicer. Well worth the price we would have paid. The Ramada Inn was awful- so run down, beds were so uncomfortable-very old mattresses, springs popping out, mattress had hills and valleys. The room was worth about $29, a night, not the great price of $90. Staff was nice, but do yourself a big favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for location”
Reviews.Author: dwSFbay
Reviews.Content: It's clean, nice, free parking I think for guests, internet works, nice staff, restaurant/pub bar is decent and roomy but only that. And you are not walking anywhere from the Hotel Circle area, it's a cab or car ride EXCEPT there are several restaurants, a great breakfast place and one of the restaurants just to the east one block is also a piano bar and is THE 'over 40' set hangout in that area. I have gone on both visits recently and had a great time, met fun people, you can dance, they have guest performers; it's great fun and great food, really.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: meymey033
Reviews.Content: I got a discounted rate of ~$130/night, realizing that for San Diego this is probably a good price. But even this is definitely overpriced for this hotel. The hotel is not near much, so unless you have a car be prepared to pay for cabs. The restaurant at the hotel is not good at all (and they overcharged for my meal). The "fitness center" is about the size of a large janitor's closet and has very little in it. As for our room, the toilet ran constantly and the bathroom was infested with flies. The supposed wireless internet that the hotel boasts did not work. When we asked at the front desk, we were told that our entire building (probably about half the rooms in the hotel) was not working. Four days later when we left, still nothing. The staff was very nice, but all in all I would recommend any of the other cheap hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza San diego was great”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad90
Reviews.Content: I had a great room with microwave and refrigerator in the building up on the hill. The maid brought us some extra pillows and towels. Lots of available parking and a first class restaurant and pub. The pool was safe for all ages with no crazy kids diving with big splashes as it is only 5 feet deep. The wireless Internet worked very fast. We zipped up the 163 freeway to the Zoo and had a great two days.

Reviews.Title: “No parking!!”
Reviews.Author: rienee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza for a one-night stay. The accommodations were ok, nothing spectacular, but then you get what you pay for. We went to dinner and came back to the hotel around 10:30 and there was absolutely NO parking! We circled the entire property, we spoke with the front desk and with other hotel personnel, they told us to park illegally on the other side of the hotel property. There were no spots there and many cars had parked there illegally. We drove around for 30 minutes and all they could say was that the hotel does not guarantee parking. Because they don't charge for parking, they don't guarantee parking. The bell hop guys told us that people are here for karaoke and they would let out around midnight if we wanted to wait until then. We had a toddler and we needed to put him to bed. I asked to speak to the manager only to be told that they can't do that. They did apologize but said there was nothing they could do. I said how can you not provide parking for your hotel guests, they said they don't guarantee parking. I told them they need to disclose that when hotel guests make reservations to stay at their hotel. WE WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL EVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Ramada Hotel Circle South”
Reviews.Author: jfloratos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while vacationing in SD. We had requested a room with microwave & fridge but were checked into a room with only fridge. We have small kids, so we asked to be moved and they did without any problems or questions. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The outside of the hotel buildings are a bit run down but the inside of the room was very nice, bedding was comfortable and the area was quiet. The location was great, just a few blocks to the I5 freeway for access downtown & only a few miles to Sea World, and a few blocks to the mall which had many eating options. I would consider staying there again because the price was so reasonable for such a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: HappyJerseyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while touring the San Diego area. The staff was very friendly and our room was exactly as described. Our room was located in the tower section at the back of the parking area - by the pool. The location of this hotel made the drive to the zoo, sea world, down town and Coronado Island convenient. Our room was located on the first floor, right by the ice machine. We did not hear anything inside our room, which was very clean and up to date. The television remote gave us a small problem when trying to adjust the volume, but we weren't there to watch t.v. so it wasn't an issue. Considering we were there for vacation at the same time (we learned a little too late) as the comic book convention, american idol tryouts and Tony Gwynn's induction to the hall of fame - an influx of 300,000 people we learned from the news - traffic still flowed, the attractions were not crowded and restaurants were accessible. Our rate for the hotel was not any more then the other hotels in the area for that weekend and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: BleednBlu
Reviews.Content: Needs a major facelift on the outside. Pool is small and only 4 feet deep. Front desk tried to stick us with two movies we didn't watch. They took them off our bill, however his tude was that he didn't believe us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the Price”
Reviews.Author: missdanib
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with one other person for a weekend getaway. The room was very clean and the hotel very safe for the price. The sink in the vanity area leaked onto to carpet when turned on, so we just used the sink in the bathroom. We purchased our room from the San Digeo Zoo web site for a very reasonable price including too tickets for two. Not the fanciest or nicest hotel, but very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little problems add up to a disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: k-ro99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel under group rate for son’s sport championship. Positives: Price, convenience, two sinks in room, small fitness room and a laundry room downstairs (didn’t use it, but others did), staff generally helpful (got a great suggestion for dinner restaurant). Cons: There were so many little things wrong that it added up to one big disappointment, which angered me more because most of it was so unnecessary. We were in the main building, in a newly decorated room, and compared to what other reviewers have said, the furniture/fixtures were in good shape. But the TV was TINY – not much bigger than my computer screen, for pete’s sake! I could only control it with the remote (not on the TV itself), which worked about one time in 20 clicks (very annoying!!). If we moved the TV even an inch, the reception was ruined. The lights near the beds didn’t work – pulled the bedside table out and found that they weren’t plugged in (and what a mess of wires and shoddy workmanship I found behind the table!) There was a switch near the door, but couldn’t figure out what it was for until I finally found a light plug that wasn’t in the socket. I couldn’t plug my cell phone charger in the plug on the mirrored wall. There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room, which was great, but they weren’t housed in a cabinet – they were just placed on the floor (microwave sitting on top of refrigerator)! There was a coffee maker, but no stirrers - when we called, we were told we could come down and get some (Hello? How about Housekeeping fixing their mistake by bringing the item to our room?). The single elevator was interminably slow, and the only stairs were at the far other end of the building from my room (the set nearest to me only allowed exit from the building). The only vending machine in the building was broken. The staffer delivering the morning USA Today at our doors used a cart with a loud squeal, which woke me up 2 hours before I needed to get up. The pool is certainly nothing fancy, but it didn’t really bother me - there really isn’t a lot of room on the lot for a pool, and I don’t think people come to this hotel/location for the pool amenities, anyway. There were plenty of towels when I was there. The restaurant seemed pricey, although supposedly it has won Ramada-based awards. I only had lunch there, but wasn’t too impressed. There were 3 workers standing around at the entrance when I walked in at 11:30 – they stared at me like I had 6 heads, which was kind of off-putting. P.S. Really enjoyed the Casa Guadalajara restaurant just a short distance from the hotel towards Old Town. Overall, the hotel served its purpose – a place to sleep while visiting San Diego for a non-tourist purpose. But with some attention to detail, and just a very little bit more effort than currently has been expended, the hotel could provide a significantly better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for budget!”
Reviews.Author: StewDogg
Reviews.Content: Great place. Friendly staff! Worth the $$

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and ejoyable,no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Andyvegas
Reviews.Content: I'm so sorry about reading such bad reviews about this nice hotel.When in San Diego this is my place to be. Even if small,the rooms feels rich and comfy,with nice warm colors.They all come with fridge,microwave and coffee machine.My gf loved the double sink.It seems tho that they are always on a short side of king beds... The staff is always helpful and the drive to downtown SD it's a breeze. The only complain was from my friends rooms wich where too close to the vending machines and therefore a bit noisy,and the elevators in the back towers wich are incrediblye slow. Other than this there is nothing wrong i have to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel. Not good for families.”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a disappointing stay at this hotel. The lobby was nice and the staff were very friendly/helpful. The first thing I noticed about our room as we entered were the old draperies and a chair with a slit down the middle. Looked like it had been sliced open some time ago. The room itself was old and worn. Ramada should be ashamed of the condition of this room and the price they charge for it. Pretty shabby place for the price. I do not recommend this hotel for families mainly because of the pool area. Kids love pools and this one is inadequate. The pool is very small and located in the upper side of the property (up a hill). It's inconvenient and nothing special. There were no towels present. The pool is not heated and to put it plainly...it is an ugly setting. The hot tub is also small and nothing special. I was very embarrassed that I had booked my child to stay at this hotel....and I am not picky. There also is not complimentary breakfast at this hotel. The reason this hotel appealed to me when I viewed it online was because it was a "hotel"...not a drive up to your room motel. Big mistake. There are many hotels very close to this one that have nicer grounds, heated pools, complimentary breakfast and nicer rooms. We stayed at one of these "cheaper" places our first night and it was much better/cheaper than Ramada Plaza Hotel Circle South. Do your research and you can make a much better choice. Ramada should put a few bucks into this place and folks would come away happier.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Keeva&JoJo
Reviews.Content: I just booked a stay via. fax & phone and I immediately regret it. No customer service what-so-ever on the phone. If this was not the only place to stay given the available dates then I would call back and CANCEL. Yes they do identify themselves when they answer the phone, but that's it for politeness! Horrible, Horrible. I will definitely be double checking their invoice and my credit card statement to make sure that I am charged for what I agreed to when booking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: VACOUPLETRAVELS
Reviews.Content: Our stay was nice. When I tried Hotwire, in hopes of getting the Doubletree, I ended up with this hotel, for the $89 price. After reading some of the average reviews, I was a bit leary before we got to the hotel. The area is OK, no stand alone restuarants, only alot of hotels. When we checked in, we came across some friendly staff. Although our King Bed, requested, was not ready at 3:30PM, they did give us 2 Queens. The lobby was nice, and although this was a small hotel, they did have free high speed internet, and I think they had wireless. They had alot of vending machines, and most essentials that one would need for an overnight stay. The room and hallways were a bit AGED. The carpet could use upgrades, as well as some of the furniture. We did have a nice room, the air conditioning worked fine, as did the TV. There was a small fridge in the room, as well as plenty of space for the price. Parking was awful, especially if you came back late at night. The bed was nice and firm, not saggy like most 2-3 star hotels. Would I stay here again, probably not, but it was ok for one night, and for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: 1tallcool1
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! The only good thing this dump has going for it is it's staff -- pleasant & accomodating. But the rooms -- and we had to change rooms: both rooms have old air conditioners that barely cooled the room even though set on high/coolest setting. In the first room, the blackout draperies ended 6 inches above the sill & the reading lamp fixture was falling apart. So we moved across the hall -- draperies ok, same feeble a.c. (thank goodness the weather was wonderful). The window was broken & didn't close entirely so it couldn't be locked which would have caused another room change had we not been on the 4th floor. The window screen was bent like someone had tried to break in. The faucets were angled in the sinks at 10-11 o'clock instead of 12 o'clock making them awkward & messy. It took a call to maintenance to get the hair dryer to work. The remote for the TV stopped working & the power/on&off button on the TV worked but the TV turned itself off after 1 minute! The reading lamp fixture was coming loose from the wall. The second room was right above the bar so at about 1:30am (just as we were starting to sleep), we were awakened by loud voices & car noise. We were in Building 2 and there is no direct access to the lobby. In order to get to the lobby, you have to exit Bldg. 2 & walk outside along Building 1 to get to the Lobby (again, thank goodness for wonderful weather). The lobby was beautifully appointed -- which made the crummy rooms even more disappointing. Ramada should be ashamed of itself -- even if they plan to renovate the rooms (let's hope so!), the current rooms should be offered at a much lower price than even Hotwire had. Ramada should be ashamed of itself for asking so much money to stay in a shabby motel and for not maintaining the rooms adequately -- this is a 2-star place at best.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: boohead
Reviews.Content: After quickly checking out of the nasty days inn at mission valley we were lucky enough to find a room here on friday of memorial day weekend. The front desk clerk was very nice but also very young and seemed kind of nervous. This could be because both my credit and debit cards were both denied. They both had plenty of money but for some reason weren't working. Maybe the guy thought I was nuts or something because I was a bit worked up needing to find a room with them in such short supply and then having credit AND debit card problems. But the guy was very helpful and attentive. Finally I ended up being able to just pay cash with a hundred dollar deposit. The guy then gave me a room that he said was a business room or business person section or something...he said then we'd have a fridge and microwave. He did ask me though if my four year old daughter was a fairly quiet child because she'd need to be to stay in this area. I thought that was a little weird but hey I was thrilled to get the microwave and fridge. Oh yes he also mentioned that this room was supposedly a bit bigger than others. We stayed on the third floor in the back building. This was kind of a pain but it was nice too because the pool was clear back by this building. Sort of in the corner of the parking lot which I thought was a weird place and very inconvenient for the guests in the main building. The door into the building had a sign saying it was always locked for our safety however it was open most of the time. We took the elevator up to our room and let me tell you if this was a larger room than usual I'd really hate to see the size of the the others. This room had two queen beds and it was one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in. It had the fridge, microwave, table with two chairs, a sort of desk table and chair, and the TV in the amoiore. That was WAY too much stuff in this itty bitty room. The bathroom was very clean and pretty nice, nothing fancy but nicer than usual I'd say. Then it also had a seperate sink vanity area. It was very nice to have the two sinks and mirrors, saved us time getting ready in the morning. There was also an in room safe which was nice as well. We could see the entire pool area from our window and unfortunately we could hear just about all the noise from it too. We just turned on the fan or the air and then you couldn't hear much of it. TV came in fine but I found the channels lacking. They did offer pay movies and video games which we didn't use but is nice to have. The hotel also offered room service from their restaraunt the TIckled Trout. There was a two dollar per person charge plus a 17% gratuity added to every room service order. I thought that was high when the prices were high already for what you got. But we did use room service three or four times. Each time the food was brought up well before the amount of time they said it would take, which was great. Nothing we had from there was bad but it was nothing to write home about either, again especially with what we were paying. On one of the days my husband went down to the restaurant and got the breakfast himself which of course was much cheaper. He said the restaurant was dark and gloomy, I didn't see it myself so I can only give you his opinion. We ate next door at Ricky's for breakfast and it was okay. We also ate down the road at Valley Kitchen I believe it was called. Nothing fancy but it was decent as well. One thing I do want to complain about was the "guest laundry." This was actually a tiny area off of the exercise area that had two washers and dryers. Up untill our last night one of the washers wasn't working so that was really inconvenient. We really hated it because we were clear back in the back building so we either had to drive down and risk losing our parking spot, or walk down and back up the really steep hill with all the laundry. Plus you never knew if someone else was down there using the machines. We thought with the amount of guests at this hotel they could've offered more machines and maybe even one in the back building. To make matters worse the dryers took forever. The laundry was supposed to close at ten at night but we were up past midnight one night waiting for our clothes to dry, they never did all the way. We got so sick of going back and forth between buildings that we just sort of camped out in the lobby....with our four year old daughter. I think we sort of annoyed the front desk people but oh well maybe they should get some machines in the other building! The pool area was okay. Again very weird placement though. The pool itself was small but clean. The hot tub looked nasty on one of the nights but was fine the rest of the time. There's nobody down there keeping an eye on things and we did see some pretty rowdy drunk people at different times, but other than that it was mostly families like us. I do have to say that the hotel circle area is very convenient to sea world, mission beach, and old town. The only problem we had was wanting to find some fast food restaurants to save money. We remembered seeing a Wendy's nearby but couldn't seem to find it again. We called the front desk and they told us the closest place was some jack in the box that wasn't close at all. Eventually we found the Wendy's and a couple of other places on our own, I felt like the front desk people should've easily been able to tell us where to find the closest fast food joint though. When we checked in on the back of the hotel layout map there were decent directions to many different places you might want to visit and those came in very handy for us.The hotel circle area is very crowded though so if you want to stay out of the way you DON'T want to stay here. All in all the place was okay. For the price though they could've at least had a continental breakfast at the least. We paid anywhere from $114.00 to $179.00 on any given night we stayed so I feel like a simple free breakfast wouldn't be too much to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ck1220
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in April of 2006. From outside, the hotel looked ok. Lobby was nothing special as this was a budget hotel but we were really disappointed on the way to the room and when we got to the room. Hallway smelled pretty bad and elevator had some dark gray wood panel interior which almost make you feel depressed just looking at it. Room was pretty small, furniture was super old, wall paper was peeling, and etc. Even the mattress were even. I booked this hotel through hotwire.com and it said that this hotel has a 3 star rating. There is no way this hotel deserves 3 star rating...maybe 2 star rating, if that. Only thing nice about this hotel was the location. There are lots of restaurants and shops in the area and it's pretty close to sea world and san diego zoo area. Overall, I did not like the hotel at all and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice Boltz Fans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have stayed here for several Charger's games even though he's a Raider fan. It's great find for the price. The service availiable is extremely welcoming and helpful, and the location excellent! Be smart about why your going. It's San Diego! All you really need is a clean comfortable place to sleep before or after doing what you came there to do. If your all about posh and pampering go to "the Hotel Del Coronado" for crying out loud! The rooms are very cozy, they've got some extras, a cool bar and restauraunt. And if you need something, if they've got it they get it to you PDQ! The staff is exceptionally helpful with suggestions on what to do and how to get there. "Ye have not because Ye ask not." "Seek, knock and it will be opened for you!"

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great either”
Reviews.Author: Chickenbiscuit
Reviews.Content: Not a bad price at $80 for one night on the AAA rate booked online through the Ramada website. The room was pretty small and no breakfast to be found, not even a continental breakfast. On the plus side, the staff were very attentive and prompt with the service at check-in. Tight parking outside and seemingly very full hotel for a Wednesday night. Didn't find it to be very noisy, however. We like the Hotel Circle area, as there are a few nice family restaurants for breakfast/dinner nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: keena2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night, Aug. 2005, on a trip to SeaWorld. The front desk was extremely helpful and polite! The check in sheet had directions to local businesses on the back, which came in handy. My daughter was sick and they assisted us with warming up her soup and the restaurant gave us with crackers for her soup. They went above and beyond the call of duty to help us out, and for that I will definitely stay there again. The room was spacious and clean with a separate vanity from the bathroom, the location to the highway, restaurants, and 7-11 was very convenient. We were on the 4th floor of the 2nd building and right across the room was a cheaper hotel with some college guys partying all night, but we never even heard them. We got back from dinner about 11pm and found a better parking spot than when we checked in. We didn't use the pool, but it seemed a bit of a walk and thrown in the corner of the parking lot. However, we didn't go to San Diego to swim. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfy, and we felt safe. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CAVAtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in late July, '05. We found it to be just okay, nothing spectacular, but a safe, relatively quiet place to crash for the night. We had a bit of trouble with the charges (check all stipulations/specifics of the Zoo/Sea World/Wild Animal Park packages before booking - can be deceiving), but it was cleared up with a call to Ramada's central Guest Services folks. All in all, it wasn't awful, it wasn't outstanding, but it met our needs. Seems like they could kick in for a complimentary continental breakfast, though. The "Tickled Trout" is a bit sub-par.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: 2151 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
